chunks.zh: 劳动仲裁后续
chunks.en: Labor arbitration follow-up

chunks.zh: # 劳动仲裁心路历程
chunks.en: # My Labor Arbitration Journey

chunks.zh: 历时大半年，终于告一段落，尽管过程十分曲折，但最终的结果还算令人满意。
chunks.en: After more than half a year, it has finally come to an end. Although the process was very tortuous, the final result was still satisfactory.

chunks.zh: 在这里我要郑重地感谢 V 站上所有帮助过我的人。
chunks.en: Here, I want to sincerely thank everyone on V2EX who has helped me.

chunks.zh: 衷心地感谢各位当初对我的建议。
chunks.en: I sincerely thank you all for your suggestions back then.

chunks.zh: 也感谢 V 站这个平台，让我有了分享的意义。
chunks.en: I also thank V2EX for providing this platform, which gives me the meaning to share.

chunks.zh: 以下是我的一些心路历程，希望对大家能有所帮助。
chunks.en: The following is some of my journey, and I hope it can be helpful to everyone.

chunks.zh: ## 2024 年 7 月 28 日：准备劳动仲裁
chunks.en: ## July 28, 2024: Preparing for Labor Arbitration

chunks.zh: 与公司沟通无果，遂准备劳动仲裁。
chunks.en: After fruitless communication with the company, I prepared for labor arbitration.

chunks.zh: 当时对于初入职场的我来说，五险一金具体是什么都不太清楚，劳动仲裁更是一头雾水，于是开始寻求各方帮助。
chunks.en: At that time, as someone newly entering the workplace, I didn't quite understand what 'five social insurances and one housing fund' were, let alone labor arbitration. So I started seeking help from all sides.

chunks.zh: 所幸有了 V 友们的帮助，之后我听从了建议，在法律援助中心申请到了一名律师的帮助，后面也是按照建议补充收集证据等。
chunks.en: Fortunately, with the help of V2EX users, I followed the advice and applied for a lawyer at the Legal Aid Center. Afterwards, I also followed the advice to supplement and collect evidence, etc.

chunks.zh: ### 关于律师的申请：
chunks.en: ### About applying for a lawyer:

chunks.zh: 必须是农业户口，需要开具农业户口性质证明，当地镇上派出所就可以开具。
chunks.en: Must have an agricultural household registration (户口), and a certificate of agricultural household registration nature needs to be issued. The local town police station can issue this.

chunks.zh: ## 2024 年 8 月 1 日：签订协议，提交仲裁申请
chunks.en: ## August 1, 2024: Sign the agreement and submit the arbitration application

chunks.zh: 和法援中心签订协议及委托书后，开始和律师对接。
chunks.en: After signing the agreement and power of attorney with the Legal Aid Center, I started coordinating with the lawyer.

chunks.zh: 8 月 3 日向仲裁委提交了劳动仲裁申请书。
chunks.en: On August 3rd, I submitted the labor arbitration application to the arbitration committee.

chunks.zh: 我是向我工作所在地的管辖仲裁委提起的诉讼，还可以向公司注册地的仲裁委提起诉讼（后续麻烦的地方也在这块）。
chunks.en: I filed the lawsuit with the arbitration committee in the jurisdiction where I worked, and I could also file a lawsuit with the arbitration committee in the company's place of registration (this is where the subsequent troubles also lie).

chunks.zh: 一周之后收到了开庭通知，暂定在 8 月中旬。
chunks.en: A week later, I received a notice of hearing, tentatively scheduled for mid-August.

chunks.zh: 期间和律师商量了一下细节，准备好答辩状。
chunks.en: During this period, I discussed the details with the lawyer and prepared a defense statement.

chunks.zh: ### 8 月 14 日：第一次开庭
chunks.en: ### August 14: First Hearing

chunks.zh: 开庭当天，公司相关人员一个也没有到场，所以只能我单方面提交证据。
chunks.en: On the day of the hearing, none of the company's personnel attended, so I could only submit evidence unilaterally.

chunks.zh: 法官要求我出具在西城工作证明，我当时手里只有钉钉的打卡记录，并且是截图方式保存的。
chunks.en: The judge asked me to provide proof of working in Xicheng. At that time, I only had DingTalk check-in records in the form of screenshots.

chunks.zh: 法官不认可，要求我出示证据的“原始载体”。
chunks.en: The judge didn't accept it and asked me to show the 'original carrier' of the evidence.

chunks.zh: 但是公司在通知我的三天后就将我踢出钉钉群聊，所以钉钉上就没有企业认证，法官不认可证据。
chunks.en: However, the company kicked me out of the DingTalk group chat three days after notifying me, so there was no company authentication on DingTalk, and the judge didn't accept the evidence.

chunks.zh: **建议**：一定要及时保留相关证据，最好用带水印的录视频软件，以视频的方式保留证据。
chunks.en: **Recommendation**: Be sure to save relevant evidence in a timely manner. It is best to use video recording software with watermarks to save evidence in video format.

chunks.zh: 后来给法官看微信工作群的聊天记录，微信也没有企业认证，证明不了我和公司的雇佣关系。
chunks.en: Later, I showed the judge the chat records of the WeChat work group, but WeChat also had no company authentication and could not prove the employment relationship between me and the company.

chunks.zh: 所以法官就管辖权问题建议我们向公司注册地仲裁委提起诉讼。
chunks.en: Therefore, the judge suggested that we file a lawsuit with the arbitration committee in the company's place of registration regarding the issue of jurisdiction.

chunks.zh: 律师也是有点懵，带着我找了一堆证据，法官都不认可。
chunks.en: The lawyer was also a little confused, and brought me to find a lot of evidence, but the judge didn't accept it.

chunks.zh: 最后法官给了我们两个选择，向公司注册地提交诉讼或是等待下一次开庭。
chunks.en: In the end, the judge gave us two options: submit a lawsuit to the company's place of registration or wait for the next hearing.

chunks.zh: 我和律师沟通了一下之后选择等待下一次开庭，因为我如果重新提交诉讼，就得去另一个区重新申请律师或者我自己一个人去。
chunks.en: After communicating with the lawyer, I chose to wait for the next hearing, because if I resubmit the lawsuit, I would have to go to another district to reapply for a lawyer or go by myself.
### Complaint:

chunks.zh: 立案审核工作地点证明的时候用截图的复印件就可以，不知道为啥开庭的时候却不认可。
chunks.en: When filing the case, a photocopy of the screenshot can be used as proof of the work location. I don't know why it is not accepted during the hearing.

chunks.zh: ## 2024 年 9 月 3 日：第二次开庭
chunks.en: ## September 3, 2024: Second Hearing

chunks.zh: 经过半个月的等待，迎来了第二次开庭。
chunks.en: After half a month of waiting, the second hearing arrived.

chunks.zh: 期间我和律师一直在沟通如何证明工作地点的问题，但好巧不巧的是公司第二次派人过来了。
chunks.en: During this period, the lawyer and I kept communicating about how to prove the work location, but coincidentally, the company sent someone over for the second time.

chunks.zh: 法官问了他是否承认我在西城工作的事实，他回答承认。
chunks.en: The judge asked him if he admitted that I worked in Xicheng, and he answered yes.

chunks.zh: 就这样困扰了我半个月的证据一笔带过了。
chunks.en: In this way, the evidence that had troubled me for half a month was passed over in one stroke.

chunks.zh: 之后的流程正常进行，双方互相举证。
chunks.en: The subsequent process proceeded normally, and both parties presented evidence.

chunks.zh: 公司派过来的人是我之前的领导，也不知道他是觉得公司一定能赢还是咋的，对于我举证的大部分证据都认可，我的赔偿金额计算方式连算都没算就认可了。
chunks.en: The person sent by the company was my previous leader. I don't know if he thought the company would definitely win or what, but he recognized most of the evidence I presented, and he recognized my calculation method for compensation amount without even calculating it.

chunks.zh: 但是后来到他举证的时候他傻眼了，我对于他大部分的举证都不认可，在关键证据“劳动合同解除通知书”上，公司未能拿出有力证据证明我的过失。
chunks.en: But later, when it came to his turn to present evidence, he was dumbfounded. I did not recognize most of the evidence he presented. On the key evidence, the 'Termination of Labor Contract Notice,' the company failed to provide strong evidence to prove my fault.

chunks.zh: 反而在一些无关紧要的方面向法官举证我，比如：不参加公司培训、不服管教、经常请假等（上班时间钉钉开会议直播培训，用自己的调休也算请假？雇佣关系何来管教一说呢）。
chunks.en: Instead, he presented evidence to the judge about me in some unimportant aspects, such as: not participating in company training, disobeying discipline, frequently asking for leave, etc. (Using DingTalk for live broadcast training during working hours, and using my own time off is also considered taking leave? Where does the saying of discipline come from in an employment relationship?).

chunks.zh: 法官都没有问我是否承认就否定了他的证据。
chunks.en: The judge denied his evidence without even asking me if I admitted it.

chunks.zh: 因为公司第一次开庭未到，第二次开庭也不允许再次补充提交证据了。
chunks.en: Because the company did not attend the first hearing, it was not allowed to submit supplementary evidence again at the second hearing.

chunks.zh: 后来法官更是杀人诛心地说：如果你真正认可这些证据的话当时为什么没有把这些写到解除通知书里面呢？
chunks.en: Later, the judge said even more devastatingly: If you really recognized this evidence, why didn't you write it into the termination notice at that time?

chunks.zh: 后面还是常规流程，法官两面劝导调解。
chunks.en: The following is still the normal process, and the judge persuaded and mediated from both sides.

chunks.zh: 出人意料的是公司选择了不调解。
chunks.en: Unexpectedly, the company chose not to mediate.

chunks.zh: ## 2024 年 10 月 14 日：裁决书下来
chunks.en: ## October 14, 2024: The award came down

chunks.zh: 经过一个半月，裁决书终于下来了。
chunks.en: After a month and a half, the award finally came down.

chunks.zh: 拿到裁决书的时候真是有一种苦日子熬到头了的感觉。
chunks.en: When I got the award, I really felt like the hard days were over.

chunks.zh: 最终判了终局裁决，2n 的赔偿。
chunks.en: The final ruling was a final award, with compensation of 2n.

chunks.zh: 由于金额不大，所以裁决是终局裁决，公司不能再上诉，但可以向中级法院申请撤销裁决。
chunks.en: Since the amount was not large, the award was a final award. The company could no longer appeal, but could apply to the Intermediate People's Court to revoke the award.

chunks.zh: 我也很高兴，给律师送去了锦旗。
chunks.en: I was also very happy and sent a pennant to the lawyer.

chunks.zh: 以为会顺利拿到钱，没想到公司却是一拖再拖...
chunks.en: I thought I would get the money smoothly, but I didn't expect the company to delay it again and again...

chunks.zh: ## 2024 年 12 月 18 日：申请强制执行
chunks.en: ## December 18, 2024: Application for Compulsory Execution

chunks.zh: 在经过了 45 天的等待期之后，公司没有向中级法院申请撤销裁决，也没有对我进行赔偿。
chunks.en: After a 45-day waiting period, the company did not apply to the Intermediate People's Court to revoke the award, nor did it compensate me.

chunks.zh: 于是我准备申请强制执行。
chunks.en: So I prepared to apply for compulsory execution.

chunks.zh: 好在强制执行可以在网上办理，不用在线下跑来跑去了，还是相对方便一些。
chunks.en: Fortunately, compulsory execution can be done online, without having to run around offline, which is relatively convenient.

chunks.zh: 强制执行的过程就像又经历了一遍劳动仲裁一样，也得各种打电话咨询，提交材料等等。
chunks.en: The process of compulsory execution is like going through labor arbitration again, and you have to make various phone calls for consultation, submit materials, etc.

chunks.zh: 历经了几次驳回以后，在 2024 年 12 月 18 日网上立案成功。
chunks.en: After several rejections, the online filing was successful on December 18, 2024.

chunks.zh: 感觉这个过程还是比较折磨的，因为就算劳动仲裁赢了，也不代表能真正拿到钱，等待的过程不知道有没有意义。
chunks.en: I feel that this process is still relatively torturous, because even if you win the labor arbitration, it does not mean that you can really get the money. I don't know if the waiting process is meaningful.

chunks.zh: 期间我的父亲来过电话，本来是没想告诉他们的，但纸终究包不住火。
chunks.en: During this period, my father called me. I didn't want to tell them at first, but paper can't contain fire after all.

chunks.zh: 我的父亲是个农民，思想比较传统，还停留在那个官就是天的时代（好像放在现在也没什么错）。
chunks.en: My father is a farmer with relatively traditional ideas. He still lives in the era when officials are the sky (it seems there is nothing wrong with that even now).

chunks.zh: 呵斥我为什么好端端的工作不干要和人打官司，跟公司斗，咱们怎么可能赢得了人家啊。
chunks.en: He scolded me for not doing a good job and fighting lawsuits with others, fighting with the company. How can we possibly win against them?

chunks.zh: 由于一再的等待，我也开始怀疑，我真的能拿到钱吗，这样做真的对吗，有意义吗。
chunks.en: Due to repeated waiting, I also began to wonder, can I really get the money, is this really right, is it meaningful?

chunks.zh: ## 2025 年 1 月 3 日：成功执行，拿到赔偿
chunks.en: ## January 3, 2025: Successful Execution, Get Compensation

chunks.zh: 当时没有任何找工作的想法，甚至对工作产生了一定的抵触心理。
chunks.en: At that time, I had no idea of ​​finding a job, and even had some resistance to work.

chunks.zh: 后来跟许多同学交流的时候发现他们也被裁了，同为应届生的我们过得都不好。
chunks.en: Later, when I communicated with many classmates, I found that they were also laid off. As fresh graduates, we were not doing well.

chunks.zh: 同学说国家要解决就业问题，会给招收应届生的公司补助，公司会想办法把我们的应届生身份给“除掉”。
chunks.en: A classmate said that the country would solve the employment problem and would subsidize companies that recruit fresh graduates. The company would find ways to “remove” our status as fresh graduates.

chunks.zh: 就这样，抱着与其在外面内耗不如回家躺平的想法，在年前回到了家。
chunks.en: In this way, with the idea of ​​lying down at home rather than wasting energy outside, I returned home before the New Year.

chunks.zh: 回家之后心情也开朗了许多，好消息也接踵而至。
chunks.en: After returning home, my mood brightened a lot, and good news followed.

chunks.zh: 执行法官和我沟通了几次之后，决定在 1 月 3 日进行上门执行。
chunks.en: After the enforcement judge communicated with me several times, he decided to conduct an on-site enforcement on January 3.

chunks.zh: 好在我给法官提供了几个准确的电话号码，执行过程也很顺利（这里建议大家及早保留相关人员信息，早做打算）。
chunks.en: Fortunately, I provided the judge with several accurate phone numbers, and the execution process was very smooth (here I suggest that you keep the information of relevant personnel as soon as possible and make plans early).

chunks.zh: 前些日子也是很顺利的拿到了钱。
chunks.en: I also got the money smoothly a few days ago.

chunks.zh: 事情也算告一段落。
chunks.en: The matter is also considered to be over.

chunks.zh: 目前边学习边找工作，多学一些技术栈，丰富丰富技能，希望能早日找到一个顺心的好工作。
chunks.en: Currently, I am learning and looking for a job, learning more technical stacks and enriching my skills. I hope to find a satisfactory job soon.

chunks.zh: 也祝愿大家心想事成，都能有一个好的未来！
chunks.en: I also wish you all the best and have a good future!

chunks.zh: 恭喜，不过最后公司也只是把应该给的钱给了，没有任何惩罚，下次还是会这么对待员工，哎
chunks.en: Congratulations, but in the end the company only gave the money that should have been given, there was no punishment, and it will treat employees like this next time, sigh

chunks.zh: 所以企业才有恃无恐，搞了半天最后一点惩罚都没有，只有应拿回的 2n ，而且还得强制执行才能拿回。
chunks.en: That's why companies are unscrupulous. After a long time, there is no punishment at all. There is only the 2n that should be recovered, and it has to be enforced to get it back.

chunks.zh: “必须农业户口”的意思是不是因为，有了这个身份就能通过这一条 “农民工请求支付劳动报酬” 来免费申请法律援助？
chunks.en: Does 'must have an agricultural household registration' mean that with this status, you can apply for free legal aid through the clause 'Migrant workers request payment of labor remuneration'?

chunks.zh: @huoshanhui #14 应该是农业户口可以申请免费的法律援助吧。
chunks.en: @huoshanhui #14 It should be that agricultural household registrations can apply for free legal aid, right?

chunks.zh: @Michael001 不然怎么样呢？自己的权益自己不维护的话，指望别人是没用的。
chunks.en: @Michael001 What else can you do? If you don't protect your own rights, it's useless to rely on others.

chunks.zh: 国内打官司成本已经很低了。
chunks.en: The cost of litigation in China is already very low.

chunks.zh: 这个世上不会有无所不能的终极仲裁机，有相关法律，还得自己去主动使用法律。
chunks.en: There will be no omnipotent ultimate arbitration machine in this world. There are relevant laws, and you have to take the initiative to use them.

chunks.zh: 面对不公勇敢面对，打官司 ✔
chunks.en: Brave to face injustice, litigate ✔

chunks.zh: 现实唯唯诺诺，V 站回复重拳出击 ×
chunks.en: Being cautious in reality, and replying with heavy punches on V2EX ×

chunks.zh: 给 OP 点赞！
chunks.en: Like for OP!

chunks.zh: 所以这个劳动法有何用呢？
chunks.en: So what is the use of this labor law?

chunks.zh: 变相成为保护公司的法条，普通人知道要走这么繁琐的流程，已经劝退大部分人了，公司完全有恃无恐，直接叫你去仲裁，判下来了还不给你，还要走强制执行，这一套流程走下来，少则半年，多则一年半。
chunks.en: It has become a clause to protect companies in disguise. Ordinary people know that they have to go through such a complicated process, which has dissuaded most people. The company is completely unscrupulous and directly asks you to go to arbitration. Even if it is ruled, they will not give it to you, and you have to go through compulsory execution. This process takes at least half a year and at most one and a half years.

chunks.zh: 亲眼看到有的公司还会在判决下来后，反手用假证据起诉你，再恶心你一次，又耗多你半年，然而就算公司最后输了，也没有任何处罚，员工只能拿到应得的 2n ，公司完全没有什么损失。
chunks.en: I have personally seen some companies file a lawsuit against you with false evidence after the verdict, disgusting you again and wasting another half a year. However, even if the company loses in the end, there is no punishment, and the employee can only get the 2n they deserve, and the company has no loss at all.

chunks.zh: 恭喜！  想起来当年有一次和同事一起打车，司机侃大山，聊起来自己打官司，他说自己打过多次官司，稍微说了下。
chunks.en: Congratulations! I remember one time when I was taking a taxi with a colleague, the driver was chatting and talked about his own lawsuits. He said that he had fought many lawsuits and talked a little bit about them.

chunks.zh: 下车后，同事和我说他不喜欢这种老打官司的人。
chunks.en: After getting out of the car, my colleague told me that he didn't like people who always sue.

chunks.zh: 但是要我说啊，自己的权益就是要维护，打官司再正当不过了。
chunks.en: But I want to say, you have to protect your own rights, and it's perfectly legitimate to sue.

chunks.zh: 还有后来租房的时候，搜了一下二房东的问题，当时北京二房东特别猖獗，我甚至遇到一次看房的时候原租户还在，偷偷和我这个二房东不行别租。
chunks.en: Later, when I was renting a house, I searched for the problem of sub-letters. At that time, sub-letters in Beijing were particularly rampant. I even encountered the original tenant when I was looking at a house once, and secretly told me not to rent from this sub-letter.

chunks.zh: 但是也有人被二房东坑了打官司要回钱。  千万被怕麻烦，千万别怕打官司不好，该打就得打，这样对自己来说是维护了权益，对整个社会来说也是减少不正之风。
chunks.en: But some people were cheated by sub-letters and sued to get their money back. Don't be afraid of trouble, don't be afraid of suing is bad, you have to sue when you should. This is to protect your rights for yourself, and it is also to reduce unhealthy trends for the whole society.

chunks.zh: 即使法律不合理，闹大了也有修改法律的可能。
chunks.en: Even if the law is unreasonable, there is a possibility of amending the law if it is noisy.

chunks.zh: 什么都认那就是真的都没了。
chunks.en: If you accept everything, then you really have nothing.

chunks.zh: @Jammmm 是的，对于证据的保存我推荐多种形式，备份保存等。
chunks.en: @Jammmm Yes, I recommend various forms of evidence preservation, backup and storage, etc.

chunks.zh: 钉钉这种为企业设计的软件是不会向着我们普通人的，被踢出钉钉之后你的所有打卡记录，工资条流水，聊天记录，企业认证等都会消失。
chunks.en: DingTalk, a software designed for enterprises, will not side with ordinary people like us. After being kicked out of DingTalk, all your check-in records, salary slips, chat records, company certifications, etc. will disappear.

chunks.zh: 所以我建议及早保留证据，采用多种形式保留证据，使用多个设备保留证据。
chunks.en: So I suggest keeping evidence as soon as possible, keeping evidence in multiple forms, and using multiple devices to keep evidence.

chunks.zh: @unco020511 这是法律规定非法辞退是 2N ，就是说公司本来就该赔 2N 。
chunks.en: @unco020511 The law stipulates that illegal dismissal is 2N, that is to say, the company should have paid 2N.

chunks.zh: 贴主辛苦打官司，裁决下来公司也不给钱，最后贴主还得折腾强制执行，公司最终也只赔了法律规定的 2N
chunks.en: The original poster worked hard to fight the lawsuit, but the company did not give the money after the verdict. In the end, the original poster had to go through compulsory execution, and the company only paid the 2N stipulated by law in the end.

chunks.zh: 国内就是这样，讨薪的劳动合同纠纷案件并不复杂，甚至自己了解下都不需要律师协助，只是最后强制执行很有难度，LZ 这个案例是有法官帮上门执行的，实际挺多案例只是老板给列入“老赖”名单，限制高消费之类的。
chunks.en: That's how it is in China. Labor contract disputes for wage arrears are not complicated. You don't even need a lawyer if you understand it yourself, but compulsory execution in the end is very difficult. In LZ's case, the judge helped with the on-site execution. In many cases, only the boss is put on the 'List of Dishonest Persons Subject to Enforcement,' restricting high spending, etc.

chunks.zh: 环境对老赖还是太友好了，尤其是国内各种银行卡动不动就风控锁卡的情况下，老赖怎么转移资产的还要普通人去举证，太难了
chunks.en: The environment is still too friendly to dishonest people, especially in China where various bank cards are subject to risk control and card locking at every turn. It is too difficult for ordinary people to provide evidence of how dishonest people transfer assets.

chunks.zh: @Jasmine2016 如果方便的话我建议你都留着，毕竟离职之后再要的话不是很方便。
chunks.en: @Jasmine2016 If it's convenient, I suggest you keep them all, because it won't be very convenient to ask for them again after you leave.

chunks.zh: 我给法官的是公司董事长和分公司的领导的电话。
chunks.en: I gave the judge the phone numbers of the chairman of the company and the leader of the branch.

chunks.zh: 再一个你可以去国家企业信用信息公示系统，查一下公司的股东们。
chunks.en: Also, you can go to the National Enterprise Credit Information Disclosure System to check the shareholders of the company.

chunks.zh: 通过他们的姓名，看看能不能在公司内部找到他们的电话。
chunks.en: Through their names, see if you can find their phone numbers within the company.

chunks.zh: 总之找到公司的老板电话应该就可以
chunks.en: In short, you should be able to get the company's boss's phone number.

chunks.zh: 恭喜 op ，感谢 op 为受害者提供经验。
chunks.en: Congratulations op, thank you op for providing experience for the victims.

chunks.zh: 求职者好难维护自己应得的利益
chunks.en: It is difficult for job seekers to protect their due interests.

chunks.zh: 恭喜！🎉
chunks.en: Congratulations! 🎉

chunks.zh: 恭喜，吾辈楷模！哪家渣企啊？大家注意避坑
chunks.en: Congratulations, a role model for us! Which scummy company is it? Everyone should pay attention to avoid it.

chunks.zh: 这是仲裁庭审了两次？
chunks.en: Was this arbitration hearing held twice?

chunks.zh: 按理说第一次公司不来人可以直接根据双方证据缺席裁决的，等下裁决书之后不服就到法院了
chunks.en: Logically speaking, if the company does not come the first time, a default judgment can be made directly based on the evidence from both sides. If you are not satisfied with the award, you can go to the court.

chunks.zh: “必须是农业户口，需要开具农业户口性质证明，当地镇上派出所就可以开具。”还真就是物以稀为贵，现在农业户口成 buff 了
chunks.en: 'Must have an agricultural household registration, and a certificate of agricultural household registration nature needs to be issued. The local town police station can issue this.' It's really a case of scarcity makes it valuable. Now agricultural household registration has become a buff.

chunks.zh: 恭喜 OP 拿到赔偿, 另外请问下如何在网上办理强制执行呢, 感谢
chunks.en: Congratulations to OP for getting compensation. Also, how do you apply for compulsory execution online, thank you?

chunks.zh: 恭喜 老铁， 祝你一切顺利
chunks.en: Congratulations bro, I wish you all the best

chunks.zh: @kandaakihito 这个说法我不太认可呀，应该还是有超过 1/3 的人口是农业户口的，只是年轻一代里面，比例要低，可能在 20 % 左右吧。
chunks.en: @kandaakihito I don't quite agree with this statement. More than 1/3 of the population should still have agricultural household registrations, but the proportion is lower among the younger generation, maybe around 20%.
